Crimes.Legal_Issue: Genuineness of common-law relationship and demonstration of hardship
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer found relationship not genuine due to maintained ties with Indian wife and inconsistent documentation
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Relationship evidence, medical documentation, personal history records
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections related to permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds based on non-genuine relationship and medical hardship
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of severance from prior spouse and insufficient proof of hardship
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to prove genuine relationship and establish hardship
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – officer considered all available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Demonstration of genuine relationship and unusual hardship
Crimes.Application_Factor: Common-law relationship claim and medical condition
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether decision was reasonable and procedurally fair
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Non-genuine relationship; hardship manageable in India
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent documentation regarding relationship and marital status
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s credibility undermined by failure to end prior marriage
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review challenging reasonableness of decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness in assessment
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of relationship breakdown
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and lack of genuine relationship

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Permanent residency application based on misrepresentation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Genuineness of common-law relationship, identity verification, hardship, and establishment in Canada
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refusal based on misrepresentation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubts about genuineness of relationship and identity due to discrepancies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Identity documents, relationship proofs, medical reports
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 4, s. 124(a); Federal Courts Act s. 18.1(4)(d)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Permanent residency via humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Contradictory marital status and insufficient medical hardship evidence
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to prove genuine relationship, identity, and hardship
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision upheld with minor error not affecting outcome
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Paternity evidence – minor error but did not impact overall decision
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Burden on applicant to prove claims under IRPR
Crimes.Application_Factor: Common-law partnership, identity, medical hardship, integration in Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of application based on misrepresentation
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence supporting relationship, identity, and hardship claims
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA ss. 4, 124(a); Federal Courts Act s. 18.1(4)(d)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in documentation and insufficient medical evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be procedurally fair
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged use of conflicting names in documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s credibility challenged due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of refusal
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and procedural fairness
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to resolve identity discrepancies and substantiate claims

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Identity verification due to forged documents
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant established identity despite document discrepancies
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Serious doubts about identity due to forged documents and dual names
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Identification documents, travel records, removal proceeding records
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Provisions requiring proof of identity under immigration law
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Establishment of identity for permanent residency
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of officer’s doubt based on evidence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of forged documents and conflicting names
Crimes.Application_Error: Submission of forged documents and inconsistent identification
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – officer acted on significant discrepancies
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must prove identity through reliable documentation
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Failure to establish identity leading to application denial
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was it reasonable for the officer to doubt the applicant’s identity?
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration law requirement to prove identity
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Use of forged documents and conflicting identity information
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: General provisions under IRPA regarding identity and admissibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Forged documents and use of multiple names
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Severe credibility concerns due to falsified documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review alleging unreasonable identity finding
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fair opportunity to respond to identity concerns
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide authentic and consistent identification
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and use of false documents under IRPA
